    • Method Detail

      • getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationsFromGivenEntity

        public static java.util.List<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.reflect.Field,Entity>> getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationsFromGivenEntity(NliEntity fromEntity,
                                                                                                                                                boolean deterministicOrder)
        Parameters:
        deterministicOrder - When true, the order of the returned list is deterministic (might cost in computation time - sorting primitive entities if necessary). When true, all non-primitive collection relation fields must be a subtype of List (an exception is thrown otherwise). If a relation field is a List, the order of the related elements in the returned list match the order of the list field.
        Returns:
        each (field,entity) pair returned matches an entity such that the relation (fromEntity,entity) is represented by the relation 'field' which is a field of 'fromEntity'. This methods performs setAccessible(true) on all returned fields. Note that the returned list may contain multiple entries for the same field.

      • getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity

        public static java.util.List<Entity> getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity(NliEntity fromEntity,
                                                                                  boolean deterministicOrder,
                                                                                  java.lang.reflect.Field relation)
        Parameters:
        deterministicOrder - When true, the order of the returned list is deterministic (might cost additional computation time - sorting primitive entities if necessary). When true, if 'relation' is a non-primitive collection relation field, it must be a subtype of List (an exception is thrown otherwise). If a relation field is a List, the order of the related elements in the returned list match the order of the list field.
        Returns:
        the returned list contains entity x iff (fromEntity,x) is represented by the 'relation' which is a field of 'fromEntity'. This methods performs setAccessible(true) on 'relation'.

        public static boolean isRelationField(java.lang.reflect.Field field)

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getRelationFieldsOfNliEntityClass(java.lang.Class<? extends NliEntity> clazz,
                                                                                        boolean deterministic)
        Parameters:
        deterministic - when true the returned list is sorted according to some deterministic order.

      • getPrimitiveEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity

        public static java.util.List<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.reflect.Field,PrimitiveEntity>> getPrimitiveEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity(NliEntity fromEntity,
                                                                                                                                                                 boolean deterministicOrder)
        This methods performs setAccessible(true) on all returned fields.
        Parameters:
        deterministicOrder - see getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationsFromGivenEntity(NliEntity, boolean)
        Returns:
        each pair (field,primitive) returned matches a primitive such that the relation (fromEntity, primitive) is represented by 'field' which is a field of 'fromEntity'. Note that the returned list may contain multiple entries for the same field. If a relevant relation field is a List, the order of the related elements in the returned list match the order of the elements of the field list.

      • getNonPrimitiveEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity

        public static java.util.List<org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<java.lang.reflect.Field,NliEntity>> getNonPrimitiveEntitiesInOutgoingRelationFromGivenEntity(NliEntity fromEntity,
                                                                                                                                                              boolean deterministicOrder)
        Parameters:
        deterministicOrder - see getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationsFromGivenEntity(NliEntity, boolean)
        Returns:
        each pair (field,toEntity) returned matches an entity such that the relation (fromEntity, toEntry) is represented by 'field' which is a field of 'fromEntity'. This methods performs setAccessible(true) on all returned fields. Note that the returned list may contain multiple entries for the same field. If a relevant relation field is a List, the order of the related elements in the returned list match the order of the elements of the field list.

      • getNonPrimitiveEntitiesReachableFromRoot

        public static java.util.List<NliEntity> getNonPrimitiveEntitiesReachableFromRoot(NliRootEntity root,
                                                                                 boolean includeRootEntity,
                                                                                 boolean deterministicOrder)
        Parameters:
        includeRootEntity -
        deterministicOrder - see getEntitiesInOutgoingRelationsFromGivenEntity(NliEntity, boolean)
        Returns:
        all reachable entities (including the root) in depth-first search pre-order.

      • getPossiblyReachableNliEntityClasses

        public static java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends NliEntity>> getPossiblyReachableNliEntityClasses(java.lang.Class<? extends NliRootEntity> rootEntityClass,
                                                                                                              boolean includeRootInResult,
                                                                                                              boolean deterministic)
        Parameters:
        includeRootInResult - note that we add the root to the result list (regardless of 'includeRootInResult') if it is reachable by a non-empty path from root (due to the entity graph being cyclic).
        deterministic - when true the returned list is sorted according to some deterministic order.
        Returns:
        all the NliEntity classes that may be reachable from an entity of type 'rootEntityClass'. TODO: test

      • entityGraphToHumanFriendlyString

        public static java.lang.String entityGraphToHumanFriendlyString(NliRootEntity root,
                                                                boolean deterministic)

      • entityGraphEquals

        public static boolean entityGraphEquals(NliRootEntity root1,
                                        NliRootEntity root2)
        The order of entities in collection fields matter (think of the edges of the graph as being tagged with the index). If there's a collection field of non-primitive entities, and the collection is not a list - an exception is thrown (because we have no tractable way of checking equality).
